newsitem.title: USA: Texas/w Okla fed cattle market roundup - USDA.
newsitem.headline: Texas/w Okla fed cattle market roundup - USDA.

text.p: Trade was active in the Panhandle area on Thursday, USDA said.

Slaughter steers and heifers were $1.00 per cwt higher than last test. Feedlots reporting good inquiry from buyers. Sales reported on 28,200 slaughter steers and 13,800 heifers; 69,000 head confirmed for the week to date which includes 17,500 formulated and 200 previously contracted cattle to be shipped this week.
Note - all cattle prices based on net weights FOB the feedlot after a 4 percent shrink.

Slaughter Steers - Select and Choice 2-3 1150-1250 lbs 66.00, pen North Plains 67.00. Select, few Choice 2-3 1175-1250 lbs 65.00. Pen mostly Select 1300 lbs 63.00. Hot Carcass Basis - Select and Choice 2-3 1200 lbs 106.00.
Slaughter Heifers - Select and Choice 2-3 1050-1150 lbs 66.00, pen North Plains 67.00. Select, few Choice 2-3 1100-1150 lbs 64.50-65.00. Hot Carcass Basis - Select and Choice 2-3 1100 lbs 106.00.
Wk to date - 69,000 Week Ago - 69,800 Year Ago - 128,700
